***Hello, I'm Carter.***

I am an MA candidate at the University of Waterloo, where I study in Clara Colombatto's [Vision and Cognition Laboratory.](https://colombattolab.com/)

My research asks: when humans interact with other people, are there low-level cues (e.g., velocity of anothers' movements) that (1) allow for inferences about others (e.g., others' intentionality) and (2) influence the cognition of the observing person (e.g., their attention)?
